title: "index out of bounds" in on_disk_cache.rs (until running cargo clean)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

I cannot provide a minimal verifiable example as it happens in a larger project that is not public yet. The error is only reproducable until I enter `cargo clean`. I have experienced this (or a similar problem) several times. After `cargo clean` my code always compiles properly (assumingly).

I'm using the following unstable features:

```
#![feature(generic_associated_types)]
#![feature(associated_type_defaults)]
#![feature(try_blocks)]
```

If there is anything I should do to narrow the problem down, please write a comment to this issue and I can try to provide additional information the next time this problem occurs again.

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.59.0-nightly (23f69235a 2021-12-20)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 23f69235ad2eb9b44ac1a55eeaa3f9b484d9de4a
commit-date: 2021-12-20
host: x86_64-unknown-freebsd
release: 1.59.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```

### Error output

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 277 but the index is 289', compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/on_disk_cache.rs:712:18
stack backtrace:
   0: rust_begin_unwind
             at /rustc/23f69235ad2eb9b44ac1a55eeaa3f9b484d9de4a/library/std/src/panicking.rs:498:5

note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.59.0-nightly (23f69235a 2021-12-20) running on x86_64-unknown-freebsd

note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `types::MaybeInteger::try_as_u64`
end of query stack
error: could not compile `undisclosed_crate`
```
